00026 #include <assert.h>

00033 kmScalar kmPlaneDot(const kmPlane* pP, const kmVec4* pV)
00034 {
00035         //a*x + b*y + c*z + d*w
00036 
00037         return (pP->a * pV->x +
00038                         pP->b * pV->y +
00039                         pP->c * pV->z +
00040                         pP->d * pV->w);
00041 }
00042 
00043 kmScalar kmPlaneDotCoord(const kmPlane* pP, const kmVec3* pV)
00044 {
00045         return (pP->a * pV->x +
00046                         pP->b * pV->y +
00047                         pP->c * pV->z + pP->d);
00048 }
00049 
00050 kmScalar kmPlaneDotNormal(const kmPlane* pP, const kmVec3* pV)
00051 {
00052         return (pP->a * pV->x +
00053                         pP->b * pV->y +
00054                         pP->c * pV->z);
00055 }
00056 
00057 kmPlane* kmPlaneFromPointNormal(kmPlane* pOut, const kmVec3* pPoint, const kmVec3* pNormal)
00058 {
00059         /*
00060                 Planea = Nx
00061                 Planeb = Ny
00062                 Planec = Nz
00063                 Planed = −N⋅P
00064         */
00065 
00066 
00067         pOut->a = pNormal->x;
00068         pOut->b = pNormal->y;
00069         pOut->c = pNormal->z;
00070         pOut->d = -kmVec3Dot(pNormal, pPoint);
00071 
00072         return pOut;
00073 }
00074 
00079 kmPlane* kmPlaneFromPoints(kmPlane* pOut, const kmVec3* p1, const kmVec3* p2, const kmVec3* p3)
00080 {
00081         /*
00082         v = (B − A) × (C − A)
00083         n = 1⁄|v| v
00084         Outa = nx
00085         Outb = ny
00086         Outc = nz
00087         Outd = −n⋅A
00088         */
00089 
00090         kmVec3 n, v1, v2;
00091         kmVec3Subtract(&v1, p2, p1); //Create the vectors for the 2 sides of the triangle
00092         kmVec3Subtract(&v2, p3, p1);
00093         kmVec3Cross(&n, &v1, &v2); //Use the cross product to get the normal
00094 
00095         kmVec3Normalize(&n, &n); //Normalize it and assign to pOut->m_N
00096 
00097         pOut->a = n.x;
00098         pOut->b = n.y;
00099         pOut->c = n.z;
00100         pOut->d = kmVec3Dot(kmVec3Scale(&n, &n, -1.0), p1);
00101 
00102         return pOut;
00103 }
00104 
00105 kmVec3* kmPlaneIntersectLine(kmVec3* pOut, const kmPlane* pP, const kmVec3* pV1, const kmVec3* pV2)
00106 {
00107         /*
00108                 n = (Planea, Planeb, Planec)
00109                 d = V − U
00110                 Out = U − d⋅(Pd + n⋅U)⁄(d⋅n) [iff d⋅n ≠ 0]
00111         */
00112     kmVec3 d;
00113         assert(0 && "Not implemented");
00114 
00115 
00116         kmVec3Subtract(&d, pV2, pV1); //Get the direction vector
00117 
00118 
00119         //TODO: Continue here!
00120         /*if (fabs(kmVec3Dot(&pP->m_N, &d)) > kmEpsilon)
00121         {
00122                 //If we get here then the plane and line are parallel (i.e. no intersection)
00123                 pOut = nullptr; //Set to nullptr
00124 
00125                 return pOut;
00126         } */
00127 
00128     return NULL;
00129 }
00130 
00131 kmPlane* kmPlaneNormalize(kmPlane* pOut, const kmPlane* pP)
00132 {
00133         kmVec3 n;
00134     kmScalar l = 0;
00135 
00136         n.x = pP->a;
00137         n.y = pP->b;
00138         n.z = pP->c;
00139 
00140         l = 1.0f / kmVec3Length(&n); //Get 1/length
00141         kmVec3Normalize(&n, &n); //Normalize the vector and assign to pOut
00142 
00143         pOut->a = n.x;
00144         pOut->b = n.y;
00145         pOut->c = n.z;
00146 
00147         pOut->d = pP->d * l; //Scale the D value and assign to pOut
00148 
00149         return pOut;
00150 }

00153 {
00154         assert(0 && "Not implemented");
00155     return NULL;
00156 }

00162 POINT_CLASSIFICATION kmPlaneClassifyPoint(const kmPlane* pIn, const kmVec3* pP)
00163 {
00164    // This function will determine if a point is on, in front of, or behind
00165    // the plane.  First we store the dot product of the plane and the point.
00166    float distance = pIn->a * pP->x + pIn->b * pP->y + pIn->c * pP->z + pIn->d;
00167 
00168    // Simply put if the dot product is greater than 0 then it is infront of it.
00169    // If it is less than 0 then it is behind it.  And if it is 0 then it is on it.
00170    if(distance > 0.001) return POINT_INFRONT_OF_PLANE;
00171    if(distance < -0.001) return POINT_BEHIND_PLANE;
00172 
00173    return POINT_ON_PLANE;
00174 }
